channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for VT
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for VT

item.title: Report X-2023060664
item.description:
Report X-2023060664

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-29
  • City: SOUTH BURLINGTON
  • State: VT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: QA was called to a trailer on door, where it was discovered that there was a leaking Hazmat on the trailer. Box was safely pulled from said trailer and safely put in a Hazmat bin. Upon further investigation, it was determined that the Hazmat was placed in a wall of packages, higher than it should be. This might have contributed to the failure of the package. DescribePack: Leaking around the body of the drum, unsure exactly where, but does not seem to be from closure or top. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Safely placed in a Red Hazmat Bin, where it was brought to the QA Hazmat area.

item.title: Report X-2023060355

Report X-2023060355

  • Description: The shipment was discovered during sort operations. It was suspected undeclared dg, as the shipper sent the same products last week that is also being held. The shipment will be held for FAA investigation.

item.title: Report X-2023050892
item.description:
Report X-2023050892

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-17
  • City: WILLISTON
  • State: VT
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The Heavyweight area of our ramp location in Williston VT received a pallet with it's contents wrapped in black opaque shrink wrap. When package was about to be loaded to be delivered, an employee noticed the shrink wrap was ripped in a corner and a drum under the shrink wrap was marked and labeled as a class 9 Environmentally Hazardous UN 2077. Inspection of the contents found several drums all marked and labeled for travel as a regulated dangerous good, however, dangerous goods paperwork was not offered with this pack nor were the labels duplicated on the outer most package. it is possible package originated in Germany and was offered to FedEx via DHL Supply chain, however, this can not be substantiated. Package has been held at station pending FAA investigation.
